metadata.titleEn: In situ geochemical data of Cassiterite from Gaosong Sn-Cu deposit in Gejiu area (2018)
metadata.description: The data are U-Pb ages and in-situ major and trace geochemical data of cassiterite. The samples are from the  Gaosong Sn-Cu deposit in Gejiu area, Southwest China. Samples GS-1 are from cassiterite-sulfide deposits in skarn, and samples LTB-1 and LTB-2 are from cassiterite -iron oxide ± Sulfide deposits deposits in carbonate rocks. The major element geochemical data of cassiterite are obtained by electron probe microanalysis, and the in situ U-Pb age and trace element geochemical data of cassiterite are obtained by laser ablation inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. The obtained data can constrain the time of Sn mineralization and the precipitation environment of cassiterite in the Gaosong Sn-Cu deposit, thus figuring out the  the genesis of layered cassiterite iron oxide ± sulfide ore.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file. The file name "UPB. XLS" represents cassiterite radioisotope data. The file name "CstMaj" represents the geochemical data of cassiterite major elements. The file name "CstTra" represents the trace element geochemical data of cassiterite.

authorList.unitEn: Guangzhou Institute of Geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: Genesis of the Gaosong Sn–Cu deposit, Gejiu district, SW China: Constraints from in situ LA-ICP-MS cassiterite U–Pb dating and trace element fingerprinting
literatureList.referenceEn: Guo, J., Zhang, R., Li, C., Sun, W., Hu, Y., Kang, D., & Wu, J. (2018). Genesis of the Gaosong Sn-Cu deposit, Gejiu district, SW China: Constraints from in situ LA-ICP-MS cassiterite U-Pb dating and trace element fingerprinting. Ore Geology Reviews, 92, 627-642. doi:10.1016/j.oregeorev.2017.11.033

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the data collection methods used to obtain in-situ geochemical data for cassiterite in mineral deposits?
Feature Specification.Answer: major element geochemical data, electron probe microanalysis, in-situ U-Pb dating, trace element geochemical data, laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Definition.Question: What does 'in-situ geochemical data' mean in the context of tin mineralization studies?
Definition.Answer: In the context of tin mineralization studies, 'in-situ geochemical data' refers to geochemical information obtained directly from the mineral samples in their original location or context, without removing them from their geological environment. This data is collected using in-situ analytical techniques such as laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS), which allows researchers to determine U-Pb ages and analyze major and trace elements in minerals like cassiterite directly from the sample.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the choice of in situ geochemical analysis techniques for cassiterite in the Gaosong tin-copper ore field?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The choice of in situ geochemical analysis techniques, such as electronic probe analysis and laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, is influenced by the need to accurately determine the U-Pb age and trace element composition of cassiterite. These methods allow researchers to constrain the timing of tin mineralization and the depositional environment of cassiterite, leading to insights into the genesis of layered cassiterite-iron oxide±sulfide ores.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of collecting in-situ geochemical data and U-Pb age data from cassiterite samples in the Gaosong tin-copper ore field?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective of collecting in-situ geochemical data and U-Pb age data from cassiterite samples in the Gaosong tin-copper ore field is to constrain the timing of tin mineralization and to understand the precipitation environment of cassiterite. This helps in determining the genesis of the layered cassiterite-iron oxide ± sulfide ores.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the instrumental and procedural steps involved in collecting in-situ U-Pb age and geochemical data of cassiterite from skarn and carbonate-hosted deposits in the Gaosong tin-copper ore field?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The collection of in-situ U-Pb age and geochemical data for cassiterite involves using laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (LA-ICP-MS) for U-Pb dating and trace element analysis. For major element geochemical data, electron probe microanalysis (EPMA) is utilized. Samples are taken from different mineral deposit types in the Gaosong field, including cassiterite-sulfide deposits from skarn and cassiterite-iron oxide ± sulfide deposits from carbonate rocks. These methods help in constraining the timing of tin mineralization and the depositional environment of cassiterite.

Enablement.Question: What technological advancements have enabled the precise in-situ geochemical analysis and U-Pb dating of cassiterite in tin-copper mineral fields?
Enablement.Answer: The use of electron probe microanalysis for major element geochemical data and laser ablation-inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry for in-situ U-Pb dating and trace element geochemical data has enabled precise analysis in the field of tin-copper mineralization.
